channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #069
item.description: Last week I officially launched at Faria, my current employer, a public tips website called Faria Dev Tips. I has a lot in common with Green Ruby. The topics covered are the same, it covers rails, ruby, js, devops, design, css, with the same fullstack approach. The origin of it is also very similar. Both come from internal communication and evolve to open sharing. Check it out, you may like it :)
item.content:encoded:
#069 - jun 1st 2014

Edito

Last week I officially launched at Faria, my current employer, a public tips website called Faria Dev Tips. I has a lot in common with Green Ruby. The topics covered are the same, it covers rails, ruby, js, devops, design, css, with the same fullstack approach. The origin of it is also very similar. Both come from internal communication and evolve to open sharing. Check it out, you may like it :)

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Letters Inc
Creative agency from japan.
XSS game
An educational training to understand about javascript web vulnerabilities.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Faria Dev Tips
Dev tips from the Faria team, a dozen per week.
Compressor.io
Compress and optimize your images, up to 90% file size reduction.
Front-end Feeds
An up to date list of RSS feeds for front-end developers.
A Hackerâ€™s Guide to Git
Written for people who already use Git, and want and advanced peek.
Endless domains
Domain suggestion tool for new gTLDs.
SubToMe
Makes it easy for people to follow web sites.
hi.diplo
Git history, deploy notifications and project events in a single timeline interface.
100+ Interesting Data Sets for Statistics
Looking for interesting data sets?
Learn Angular
Learn AngularJS with free interactive lessons.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1.2rc1
With bug fixes with a final release in the next few days.
Writefully
Uses github as the publication engine for a CMS.
Writefully
Uses github as the publication engine for a CMS.
Knod
A Tiny HTTP server for your current directory.
Samson
A web interface for capistrano deployments.
SocketIO 1.0
What's new in this first major release.
Headroom
Hide your header until you need it.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
RubyMotion 3.0 Sneak Peek: Android Support may 27
They are looking for testers.
Go, REST APIs, and Pointers may 27
Lessons from designing go-github, with focus on the patch operation.
MetaRuby - Building Classes Dynamically may 28
Learn how to dynamically build classes in Ruby.
Writing a Domain-Specific Language in Ruby may 28
An example of building a DSL.
How You Nest Modules Matters in Ruby may 28
There are various ways, and differences.
The Design Of SQLite4 may 28
SQLite4 is an alternative to the v3, not a replacement.
Git v2.0.0, what changed may 29
Git v2.0.0 is slightly backward-incompatible, here is where.
New Units for Responsive Designs may 29
Viewport Units for More Flexible Size Definitions.
10 Most Common Web Security Vulnerabilities may 29
.. and recommendations on how they can be avoided.
Why I Use GistBox may 31
A personal feedback from a Gistbox enthusiast.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #100 (1h) may 26
Adequately Industrious (with Aaron Patterson).
Product Hunt Radio 7 (46m) may 27
About music apps, location-sharing products, and the best new thing since the GIF.
Code Pen 013 (40m) may 27
Talk about backups behind codepen.
Ruby Rogues 158 (57m) may 28
Confessions (essentially about testing practices).
Javascript Jabber 110 (38m) may 28
Zones with Brian Ford.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #152 (1h04) may 29
Oren Dobzinski - Desk.com.
The Changelog #123 (1h15) may 29
Gittip and Open Companies with Chad Whitacre.
Ruby5 468 (5m) may 30
Magical Routes, rest-client, PostGIS with Google Maps, SSL with rails, Rails vs. Sinatra, dev blogging.

item.title: Green Ruby News #068
item.description: Testing is a hot topic recently in the rails community. Reminds me of this image. But to tell you the truth, I'm not gonna stop unit testing, even if it's not enough. So, what is new this week? As usual, a bunch of things.
item.content:encoded:
#068 - may 25th 2014

Edito

Testing is a hot topic recently in the rails community. Reminds me of this image. But to tell you the truth, I'm not gonna stop unit testing, even if it's not enough. So, what is new this week? As usual, a bunch of things.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
808 cube
A beatbox in html in 3d, careful it can be hypnotic.
Web field manual
Various links and guidelines for modern web development.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Oozled
Curated resources for everything design related.
HTTP API Design Guide
HTTP API design guide extracted from work on the Heroku Platform API.
Web Api gap
A comparison of various features and APIs across mobile platforms.
RAML
RESTful API Modeling Language.
Captain icon
A free set of 350 vector icons and a cool design for the website.
Opbeat
Extends GitHub, tracks releases, catches Python/Ruby/Node.js exceptions.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 1.9.3-p547
Very minor released, only fixes an SSL issue with old libs.
Devise 2 factor
Barebones two-factor authentication with Devise.
Simple token authentication
Simple (but safe) token authentication for Rails apps or API with Devise.
DoBy
Automatically expiring TODO notes in Ruby.
ActiveJob
Declare job classes that can be run by a variety of queuing backends.
Smart Listing
AJAX-enabled data lists with support for sorting, filtering and in-place editing.
OSWAP Mantra
It's a browser and a security toolkit.
Honey Badger
Honeybadger will dig up juicy informations about the site you are on.
Famo.us
A JS framework focused on modern animation and transformation, definitely graphical.
Jr static
Static web generator that moves the 'generator' part to the browser.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
About Martini may 19
Martini has lived, now Negroni is the new idiomatic web framework.
Git Undo by Example may 21
Some common recovery scenarios.
Alert Design may 21
Sometimes the alerts do little more than tell us that something went bump.
Notable Changes in RSpec 3 may 21
3.0.0 final is just around the corner.
Caching in Rails 4 Applications may 22
Focus on some ways to handle cache in rails 4 with memcached and/or varnish.
How to handle big repositories with git may 22
Some ideas and techniques to deal properly with the different categories of huge repo.
Inspiration for article intro effects may 22
Some inspiration for effects applied to title headers of articles with a fullscreen image.
Crowdfunded RVM 2.0 may 23
Lists what is planned for the new RVM 2.0.
Upgrading to Ruby 2.1 may 23
Perfs improvements and how YAML parsing changed.
Next-Generation Responsive Web Design Tools may 23
Review of Webflow, Edge Reflow and Macaw

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Rails 4.1 variants (3m)
How to setup and use the new Rails 4.1 feature variants..
OpenStack 2014 (38 videos) may 20
The videos os the OpenStack Summit Atlanta 2014.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #99 (20m) may 19
You Are Not Alone (Greg Baugues about mental illness).
The Changelog #122 (1h13) may 19
Rails Girls Summer of Code and Travis Foundation with Anika Lindtner and Floor Drees.
Product Hunt Radio 6 (44m) may 20
About time-saving products, new startup funding options, and fertility apps.
Ruby5 466 (6m) may 20
Unexpected new Ruby, plenty of SMTP, Discovery Tests, building ROM, Windows ExecJS, Napybaras, and dangerous :nodocs: .
Code Pen 012 (39m) may 21
Talking about VC funding.
Arrested DevOps 11 (1h) may 21
DevOps at Etsy: Not a Unicorn, Just a Sparkly Horse.
Ruby Rogues 157 (1h23) may 21
Book Club â€“ Object Design Book Club with Rebecca Wirfs-Brock.
Javascript Jabber 109 (46m) may 21
Dependency Injection in JavaScript with Vojta JÃ­na & Misko Hevery.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #151 (1h25) may 23
Ross Penman - 15 yr old Scottish programmer.
Ruby5 467 (5m) may 23
Rspec3 rc1, ActiveJob, Devise-two-factor, Camcorder, Teaching kids of Pis, Weirich on Exceptions.

item.title: Green Ruby News #067
item.description: This week may be a good time to book your ticket for RedDot rubyconf in Singapore, it's not full yet. For the rest, here is our weekly list of links, now sent to 250 subscribers in 45 different countries (I updated the map last week).
item.content:encoded:
#067 - may 18th 2014

Edito

This week may be a good time to book your ticket for RedDot rubyconf in Singapore, it's not full yet. For the rest, here is our weekly list of links, now sent to 250 subscribers in 45 different countries (I updated the map last week).

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Purple Rock Scissors
Very nice website from a digital creative agency.
Best keyboards for programming
Such an important peripheral. Maybe you need a new one ?
Spurious Correlations
Totally fantasist data correlations, quite a taste of British humor actually.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby backports
Service to backport gems to discontinued versions of Ruby or Rails.
NerdyData
A Search Engine for (HTML) Source Code.
mkdown
Mkdown renders Markdown GitHub gists with alternative CSS.
Finch
View your local websites on any internet connected device.
Trolldor
The global blacklist of twitter trolls. Also show some stats for any twitter account.
Web Compat
Bug reporting for the internet.
OAuth Security Cheatsheet
Bad OAuth is an easy backdoor. Learn and secure.
Tutum
Run, monitor, and scale Docker containers.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Padrino 0.12.2
Ruby lightweight web framework silently makes its progress.
AniJS
Declarative handling library for CSS animations.
Octotree
Chrome extensions to display GitHub code in tree format.
Byebug
Debugging in Ruby 2.
Simple calendar
Easy rendering a calendar in rails.
CoreOS
Linux for Massive Server Deployments.
Shepherd
Shepherd is a javascript library for guiding users through your app.
Tmuxinator
Manage complex tmux sessions easily.
SyncThing
Open Source Continuous Replication / Cluster Synchronization Thing.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
New rails 4.1 travel_to test helper may 11
Would it be the end of the timecop?
Morphing buttons concpet may 12
An inspirational example for buttons that become what you click towards.
Getting into OpenSource with LookingForPullRequests may 13
If you wonder where to start participating, this could be a good way in.
Intro++ to Go Interfaces may 13
Interfaces are one of it's best features in go, but they can be confusing.
Eight Terminal Utilities for OS X Command Line may 14
open, pbcopy, mdfind, screencapture, launchctl, say, diskutil, brew.
Docker is the heroku killer may 14
Some thoughts from a docker addict.
Test Isolation Is About Avoiding Mocks may 15
Isolated testing done test-first exposes design mistakes before they're made.
Rails idioms considered harmful may 17
Something encourages us to treat our Rails apps as if they are simply a web interface to the database.
Remote access to Docker with TLS may 17
Use an exposed secure port instead of the local socket.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
The DHH Problem (3m)
3 mins talk about DHH's effect, fun to watch.
Introduction to Polymer (20m) may 12
The Next Generation of Web Development - Matthew McNulty.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #98 (20m) may 12
Memorization Techniques (Chris Hunt from github).
Code Pen 011 (31m) may 13
Licenses, Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.
Product Hunt Radio 5 (39m) may 13
Home screen apps, Swell, Semilâ€™s approach to investing, and washing vegetables in the shower.
Ruby5 464 (6m) may 13
Ruby 2.1.2 and 2.0.0, Jekyll 2.0, CVE Dispute, Rails Batched Queries, FiniteMachine.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #150 (58m) may 14
Jamis Buck - Basil & Fabian (formerly of 37signals).
Ruby Rogues 156 (1h13) may 14
Hardware Hacking with Julia Grace.
Javascript Jabber 108 (46m) may 14
AngularJS with Igor Minar.
Ruby5 465 (5m) may 16
Quill, free programming books, OAuth Security Cheatsheet, Ahoy email, Mailkick.

item.title: Green Ruby News #066
item.description: A lot of new releases this week, both on ruby, and on rails, but also various others. We also have a lot of podcasts at the bottom too.
item.content:encoded:
#066 - may 11th 2014

Edito

A lot of new releases this week, both on ruby, and on rails, but also various others. We also have a lot of podcasts at the bottom too.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Playing Cards for Web Developers
Great gift for beginners.
Resources For Free, Legal Web Images
When original photo is not possible, and budget is tight, royalty-free photos can help.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
WebComponents.org
A place to discuss and evolve web component best-practices.
Moqups
New version of Moqups is available. Make mockups online.
StyleStats
Instantly give stats on CSS for any website.
SourceMaking
A general purpose collection of patterns references for coders.
Leanstack
See what the best startups and companies in the world are using.
Accent Learners
If your boss rolls eyes at your English accent, make him pay you this (yeah most Green Ruby readers are not English native speakers actually).
Rails Refactoring
This is another book about fearless refactoring, published this year.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1.2
With Hash#reject regression fix.
Rails 3.2.18, 4.0.5, 4.1.1
This is a security release related to CVE-2014-0130.
Jekyll turns 2.0.0
Exactly one year after the 1.0.0, this version has a lot of changes.
Atom open sourced
This was uncertain for a while, but they made it! Great move.
PacketBeat
Open Source application monitoring & packet tracing system.
Slush
A Better Web App Scaffolding Tool.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
How to Override Default Primary Key Id in Rails apr 18
Integer primary keys are not the only way.
10 useful vim plugins for Ruby may 2
Many of you probably have those installed, but who knows.
Reform 1.0 â€“ Form Objects For Ruby And Rails may 5
Examples of usage for the release of the 1.0 of reform.
Getting gulpy may 6
Advanced tips for using gulp.js.
Reading Position Indicator may 7
Very nice when the page gets long.
Angular resources for your Rails API may 7
Automatically generate them, with some rails route setup.
Ruby 2.1 In Detail may 6
Changes and improvements in the last ruby version.
Mastering Rails Validations - Objectify may 8
Advanced techniques for managing validations, a sequel from a link published last week.
Bootstrap 3 Tips and Tricks You Might Not Know may 8
Various tricks to make Bootstrap more docile.
Shoes 4 preview released may 10
This is the new shoes, so you can throw away the old ones. Help find bugs before the release.
When to Mock may 10
Great review of mocking by Uncle Bob.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
RailsConf 2014 (26 videos)
The whole conf. Pay attention to the DHH keynote it seems to be quite controversial.
GopherCon 2014 (7 videos)
The first Go conference.
Network connectivity: optional (29m) may 7
Off-line access and the web.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Code Pen 010 (30m) may 5
Marketing email, transactional email, all kinds of email.
Giant robots #97 (26m) may 5
Railing Against Rails (Ernie Miller).
Product Hunt Radio 4 (42m) mat 6
At Everywhere else conference, discussion between Josh Miller, Ben Yokovitz, Ryan Hoover.
Ruby5 462 (7m) may 6
Good news from the Ruby Core meeting, TDD debates galore, AdequateRecord, and some surprisingly uneventful code ping pong.
Ruby Rogues 155 (1h16) may 7
Why Ruby Sucks.
Javascript Jabber 107 (52m) may 7
ClojureScript & Om with David Nolen.
TheChangelog 121 (57m) may 8
Dart with Lars Bak and Seth Ladd from Google.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #149 (1h) may 8
This podcast was revived after 5 years of silence in march. This episode is about early days of Ruby and Rails and the heterogeneous architecture of Wunderlist with Chad Fowler.
Arrested DevOps 10 (1h) may 8
Scaling the Application Mountains.
NodeUp 63 (2h03) may 9
a live lnug show.
Ruby5 463 (5m) may 9
Untangline spaghetti code, opening the Atom source, better presenters with DumbDelegator, managing your OS X setup with osxc, an intro to Rails view caching, and the Eldritch async DS.

item.title: Green Ruby News #065
item.description: Hey if you know rails and are between jobs, why not come to Taiwan teach a few months ? Check this announce (pdf), this may be the occasion (it's paid and hosted).
item.content:encoded:
#065 - may 4th 2014

Edito

Hey if you know rails and are between jobs, why not come to Taiwan teach a few months ? Check this announce (pdf), this may be the occasion (it's paid and hosted).

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Guillaume Juvenet
A simple but nicely done resume website.
The expressive web
Showcase of some of the newest features being added to the web today (by adobe).

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Sublime Text Cheat Sheet for Ruby & RoR
A handy PDF to print and stick on your wall.
Dorm Room Tycoon
Insightful interviews for designers, hackers and startup founders.
Google web fundamentals
Comprehensive resource for multi-device web development.
ASCII to PNG
Instantly makes png out of ascii charts.
Perfect Icons
The easiest way to create resolution independent social icons.
Pesticide
Faster CSS layout debugging chrome extension.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Nodegh
GitHub command line tools.
Synvert
Convert ruby code to better syntax (also helpful for rails upgrade to 4.0).
Various
simple ActionPack::Variant configuration for Rails 4.1.
Ahoy
Simple, powerful visit tracking for Rails.
Sandimeter
Static analysis tool for checking Ruby code for Sandi Metz' rules.
Oauthd
The open source version of the OAuth.io core.
Circular
An open source Buffer app.
Velocity
Accelerated JavaScript animation as jQuery plugin.
jQuery 1.11.1 and 2.1.1
A new jquery with some bug fixed.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
SSH Kung Fu apr 27
A great list of tips for having a deeper use of SSH.
Go, Robots and Code Refactoring apr 28
A dive into gobots, an occasion for some go tips.
Vagrant as Docker-Based Development Environments apr 28
Feature Preview of the next 1.6 version of Vagrant.
Test-induced design damage apr 29
DHH strikes again on his recent argument against TDD.
Mastering Rails Validations: Contexts apr 29
Skip validations in Rails depending on contexts.
Gourmet Service Objects apr 29
A pattern for service objects explained.
Git Workflows That Work may 2
Review of 4 different git workflows.
Guarding with arrays may 3
A simple trick for prettier arrays iterations.
Speeding Up ActiveRecord Tests may 3
A trick to avoid loading the whole rails env while testing models.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
RailsConf 2014 Recap: Day 4 with Aaron Patterson (4m) apr 26
Short recap, tenderlove relaunches the beard fashion.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #96 (35m) apr 28
Business is Hard (Jeff Casimir from The Turing School).
NodeUp 62 (1h02) apr 28
a nodeconf 2014 show.
Product Hunt Radio 3 (29m) apr 29
About products, from selfie apps to new innovative healthcare solutions.
Ruby5 460 (7m) apr 29
Various, what's next, railsreloader, capistrano, angular, PG power.
Food fight show 72 (1h09) apr 29
Cookbook Patterns.
Ruby Rogues 154 (1h07) apr 30
Indie Game Development with Megan Fox.
Javascript Jabber 106 (48m) apr 30
Protractor with Julie Ralph (angular testing).
TheChangelog 120 (1h11) may 2
Ruby tooling, chruby, ruby-install, and security with Postmodern.
Ruby5 461 (5m) may 2
test-induced design damage, priscilla, advanced rake, mutation testing, worldcup2014.db.

item.title: Green Ruby News #064
item.description: That's a busy weekend for us, RubyConf taiwan just ended, check some photos. RailsConf 2014 happened at the same time and confreaks published videos on justin.tv (see below). And else in the world, here are the geeky news of the week.
item.content:encoded:
#064 - apr 27th 2014

Edito

That's a busy weekend for us, RubyConf taiwan just ended, check some photos. RailsConf 2014 happened at the same time and confreaks published videos on justin.tv (see below). And else in the world, here are the geeky news of the week.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Aquatilis
An project of exploration of oceans, superb images and nice navigation

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Accredible
Keep track of online training sessions from coursera, edX, udacity.
Pintask
Task tracker, ala Trello.
Waffle
A workflow tool for github issues.
Gandalf.io
Simple docker hosting for private images.
3D Hubs
Find a 3D printer near you.
IE status
The prevision of IE support of new css3/js/html5 features, from microsoft.
Rails 4 Application Development
I usualy don't link books in this letter, but that one is pretty good.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Allocation tracer
Allocation tracer, checking ruby objects lifecycle.
Flynn first preview
This long waited PaaS tool released its first usable version.
Gocd
Automate and streamline the build-test-release cycle for continuous delivery.
Minicron
A rails app with a GUI to manage cron jobs and notifications.
Consul
A new service discovery tool from the vagrant guys, seems like an evolution of Serf.
Shine
A library for pretty shadows.
Gogs
Self Hosted Git Service, like a gitlab limited to the git features.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Using Facebook Notes to DDoS any website apr 20
They say they cannot fix it. Read carefully and protect yourself against this.
TravisCI-like Continuous Integration with Docker and Jenkins apr 21
Zapier explains how they use jenkins, docker and github commit API.
TravisCI-like Continuous Integration with Docker and Jenkins apr 21
Zapier explains how they use jenkins, docker and github commit API.
What docker is and when to use it apr 22
A very good explanation of what docker is not, and how it compares to other technologies.
Ruby Tips Part 5 apr 22
Misc tips about ruby, also good to check the previous ones.
Ruby Security Have You Not! apr 22
Metrics from Hakiri, a service for checking gems security.
TDD is dead. Long live testing. apr 23
A shout out against test-first paradigm from the rails father.
Model-view-controller, Haskell-style apr 25
Doing MVC in Haskell.
Chrome DevTools Features You May Have Missed apr 25
6 dev features from chrome.
What Can Men Do? apr 25
Why we need more lady-coders and how to help it.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Building JavaScript Tools (29m) apr 25
JavaScript Abstract Syntax Trees and building your own tools.
RailsConf 2014 apr 25
Preview of the confreaks footage from the railsconf this weekend.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #95 (42m) apr 21
Making Time (Chas Emerick, The Quilt Project).
CodePen podcast 009 (29m) apr 22
Code quality (linting).
Product Hunt Radio 2 (32m) apr 22
About online-to-offline apps, and various other topics.
Ruby5 458 (6m) apr 22
Searchlight, no dumping, this week in rails, whiny validation, bootstrap 3 and simple forms, open source gardener.
Ruby Rogues 153 (1h10) apr 23
From the Forum, extracts from the ruby parley discourse.
Javascript Jabber 105 (1h16) apr 23
JSConf and Organizing Conferences with Chris Williams.
TheChangelog 119 (48m) apr 25
MEAN.js & Full-Stack JavaScript w/ Roie and Amos.
Ruby5 459 (6m) apr 25
letter opener web, mint-exporter, moingoid observers, DHH interview, ids_please, ruby heroes 2014.

item.title: Green Ruby News #063
item.description: On friday I will get to RubyConf Taiwan and will spread some Green Ruby stickers. I sent some last week and can send some more. If you would like to have some just contact me. Another notable event this week was the release of ubuntu 14.04, I installed the gnome version on my desktop and it's running pretty well.
item.content:encoded:
#063 - apr 19th 2014

Edito

On friday I will get to RubyConf Taiwan and will spread some Green Ruby stickers. I sent some last week and can send some more. If you would like to have some just contact me. Another notable event this week was the release of ubuntu 14.04, I installed the gnome version on my desktop and it's running pretty well.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
How to Lie with Data Visualization
Graphs are powerful, here are some perverted examples.
Untrusted
JavaScript adventure game, where some js coding is required to pass levels.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
GitHub Cheat Sheet
A list of cool features of Git and GitHub.
Shadow DOM CSS Cheat Sheet
Track the progress of all the new CSS selectors which affect the Shadow DOM.
How to X
Still in beta on invite, will enable the deployment of github repos for testing it.
Wit
Natural Language for the Internet of Things.
API glossary
Learn the lingo of Application Programming Interfaces and the acronyms, design patterns and tools that surround them.
Snap CI
The very automated, totally intuitive, hosted CI platform.
This week in rails
Interesting commits, pull requests and more from Rails. Sent every friday by mail.
localtunnel
Allows you to easily share a web service on your local development machine.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Chef DK
An official Development Kit for Chef finally.
Overcast
A simple, SSH-based cloud management CLI.
PourOver
Library for simple, fast filtering and sorting of large collections in the browser.
Tamper
Serialization protocol for categorical data.
Huginn
Build agents that monitor and act on your behalf.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Ruby's OptionParser Is All You Need apr 11
Keep it simple for comman line ruby apps.
Recursion and Memoization apr 12
Solving recursive methods by memoization approach.
Postgresql Array and Hstore Column Reference apr 14
Postgres has some special types, here is how ActiveRecord handles them.
A Quick Guide to Sublime Text apr 14
Get to know Sublime Text, a compilation of hints.
Building a Recipe Search Site with Angular and Elasticsearch apr 15
Use Elasticsearch as your entire backend.
Adding Versions to a Rails API apr 16
Example of Rails API versioning.
Some Docker Tips and Tricks apr 16
Serie of useful tricks when you start playing with docker.
An Introduction to the MEAN Stack apr 17
MEAN is an acronym for MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS and Node.js.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Objective-C for Rubyists (23m) apr 3
Overview of the syntax and semantics of Objective-C and comparison it with Ruby.
Controlling an Arduino with NodeJS and Johnny-Five (20m) apr 16
This video aims to help those new to Arduinos and NodeJS understand the basics of getting started.
CSS Animation & Progressive Enhancement (6m) apr 15
CSS tricks involving a kitten.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
CodePen podcast 008 (42m) apr 9
bad guys: the people that make life difficult for the CodePen community.
Giant robots #94 (36m) apr 14
The Nature of Writing (Diana Zmuda, Jessie Young about iOS and rails).
Product Hunt Radio 1 (42m) apr 15
The inaugural episode of this new podcast. Geeking about products.
Ruby5 456 (6m) apr 15
Heartbleed, ruby survey, enums, istats, activeadmin customizations.
Ruby Rogues 152 (1h08) apr 16
The New York Times and Ruby with Jacqui Maher.
Javascript Jabber 104 (59m) apr 16
Hypermedia APIs with Steve Klabnik.
TheChangelog 117 (1h10) apr 16
Go, Martini and Gophercasts with Jeremy Saenz.

rippersnapper, pliny, thread_safe, invoicing, recursion and memoization, gitql, bad controllers.

item.title: Green Ruby News #062
item.description: The week of the bleeding heart was busy with server upgrades. ruby recompilation, SSL renewals, passwords and keys rotations. There are so many posts about it this week.
item.content:encoded:
#062 - apr 13th 2014

Edito

The week of the bleeding heart was busy with server upgrades. ruby recompilation, SSL renewals, passwords and keys rotations. There are so many posts about it this week.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Active Theory
An impressive portfolio.
Mental Notes
A set of cards representing psychology traits that belong web design world.
Design for the web
A free book about web design.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Heartbleed tests
This one is obvious, but there is also a reverse Heartbleed tester and ruby standlone testing code.
Cross platform password manager
All this password changing may be a good time to consider using one of those tools (but I prefer pass personally).
Flaticon
The largest database of free vector icons.
Ruby Survey 2014
Started in 2008, this survey is the 4th of its kind.
Angular-rails
A free Micro eBook on Getting Started with Angular on Rails.
Designer resources
160+ sites, apps & books that I recommend any designer should check out.
RegExr
An online tool to learn, build, & test Regular Expressions.
Superhero.js
A collection of the best articles, videos and presentations about javascript.
Developer Agents
A shared newsletter promoting talented developers as soon as they become available.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1
Spring, Variants, Enums, Mailer previews, secrets.yml.
Passenger 4.0.41
The OpenSSL Heartbleed security update.
ExpressJS 4
Some nice performance improvements (but upgrading can use some attention).
Web-repl
Javascript/Web REPL in Ruby.
iHover
CSS3 hover effects pack.
PredictionIO
An open source machine learning server from Mozilla.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Go for Rubyists apr 3
Another go primer that covers the very basics of Go and compares with ruby code.
Crafting a conference talk apr 4
An extensive fedback about how to give talks.
4 Signs You're Doing Agile Development Wrong apr 4
Agile is nice, when it works. When it doesn't, here are some hints about why.
Running ElasticSearch, LogStash and Kibana in Docker apr 6
Comments about getting the ELK up in containers.
Linking docker containers with a Serf ambassador apr 7
An example setup for linking containers.
Ruby 2.1 GC: ready for production apr 8
A good reason to use Ruby 2.1.1 in production.
Using a Ruby Class To Write Functional Code apr 8
A post from Pat with once agin very deep insights into ruby language.
How To Build A Ruby Gem apr 8
With Bundler, Test-Driven Development, Travis CI And Coveralls. A long article.
The Insider's Guide to JavaScript Interviewing apr 9
Questions to ask to see if your JS candidates are what they think they are.
Heartbleed and ruby apr 10
How is Ruby affected by the bleeding.
Extract Mostly-Constant Data from the Database apr 11
Just some common sense to the sake of performance.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AngularJS and i18n (34m) apr 9
A talk by Pascal Precht at kod.io 2014.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #93 (42m) apr 7
Diversity of Approach (David Nolen from NY Times).
Ruby5 454 (6m) apr 8
postgres, tips for hiring, ruby love, proposals, conference talk, json schema, build a ruby gem, apis with rails.
Ruby5 455 (9m) apr 8
Heartbleed, tco gem, ruby 2.1 GC, hound, rails 4.1.
Ruby Rogues 151 (1h02) apr 9
The Jim Weirich Tribute Episode.
Javascript Jabber 103 (1h04) apr 9
Robots with Raquel VÃ©lez.

item.title: Green Ruby News #061
item.description:
This month on 25th there is a rubyconf in Taipei, so I prepared simple stickers because geeks like to stick stuff on their laptops. If you want some, just come there, or send me a mail see if I can send you a bunch of them.
Side Note: There is no stupid april's fool joke in this edition (pfew).
item.content:encoded:
#061 - apr 6th 2014

Edito

This month on 25th there is a rubyconf in Taipei, so I prepared simple stickers because geeks like to stick stuff on their laptops. If you want some, just come there, or send me a mail see if I can send you a bunch of them.
Side Note: There is no stupid april's fool joke in this edition (pfew).

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Nightwalk
A visit in Marseille on Cours Julien (with the french accent).
The uncomfortable
Gallery of design that for some reason made me laungh a lot.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Asia
A recent newsletter focused on ruby publication in Asia.
Nginx Admin Guide
The new official Nginx Guide, espcially good if you discover it.
The Magic of Css
A textbook with examples to (re-)learn CSS.
WakaTime
Time tracking for programmers.
Codacy
Automated code review platform (seems like codeclimate).
Ghost Inspector
Record yourself browsing. Make assertions. Replay in the cloud.
Scalyr
Monitoring tool based on log parsing, similar to logentries.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Gor
HTTP traffic replay in real-time.
Priscilla
For displaying console output values in a flashy way.
Rubymation
Smooth animation in Rubymotion.
Sysdig
Capture system state and activity from a running Linux instance.
Snapi
A modular API functionality definition tool based on sinatra.
Slick
The last carousel you'll ever need.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Wrapping C libraries with Ruby using SWIG mar 25
Write C code for ruby extensions is not that hard.
Heap Overflow in YAML mar 29
This is a vulnerability issue, that you need to get fixed.
Go development environment for Vim mar 29
vim-go is a pathogen compatible bundle.
Heroku on Docker mar 31
Examples on how to containerize your apps for Heroku.
Debugging Asynchronous JavaScript with Chrome DevTools mar 31
Now in Chrome Canary DevTools, the full call stack of asynchronous JavaScript callbacks.
What's new in edge Rails: Active Record enums apr 1
A tiny but useful new ActiveRecord feature.
Working From Home? Here's an Extra Shot of Focus apr 2
Experience from a remote worker.
The Three Most Heated Debates In Git apr 3
Pull or fetch and merge ? Merge or rebase ? Pull request or code review ?
6 JS Libraries for Building Visualized Charts & Graphs apr 3
A good selection if you need more data vizualization (and you do).
Opal: Ruby in Your Browser, the Basics apr 4
Opal translates Ruby code into Javascript..

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Setting up Bower and Polymer (23m) mar 28
A screencast with some polymer demo.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #92 (33m) mar 31
Program to the Machine You Have (Ryan Hoover from Producthunt).
Ruby Rogues 150 (1h28) apr 2
The Debugging Mindset with Danielle Sucher.
Javascript Jabber 102 (47m) apr 2
Angular and Open Source Projects with Brad Green.
NodeUp 61 (1h26) apr 2
a cls show (Continuation-Local Storage).
Ruby5 453 (5m) apr 4
Rails PDFs, ruby 2.1 GC, mobile CDN, ActiveRecord::Enum, iOS on rails.

item.title: Green Ruby News #060
item.description: Fresh links of the week. Well yes sometimes it's not that easy to write an edito.
item.content:encoded:
#060 - mar 30th 2014

Edito

Fresh links of the week. Well yes sometimes it's not that easy to write an edito.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
NZK portfolio
A designer protfolio, each link is a blast.
Visualizing Git Concepts with D3
A sandbox that visually shows what git actually does.
Cyber Threat realtime map
Not that useful, but beautiful :)

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
WebDesign Repo
A selected list of web design related links.
Elasticsearch â€“ the definitive guide
The Book for elasticsearch, now available online.
Google Cloud DNS
DNS management that has an API.
Dribbbox
Your Dribbble portfolio in a simple js script you can put anywhere.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Reek
Code smell detector for Ruby.
Sidekiq 3.0
A new big milestone for this background job manager.
Rails 4.1.0 rc2
Last stop before 4.1.0 final.
Motion Prime
RubyMotion apps development framework.
Friction
A tool to check if your project is contribution friendly.
Epic Editor
Embeddable JavaScript Markdown editor.
Framework7
Full Featured HTML Framework For Building iOS7 Apps.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Form object validations in Rails 4 mar 22
Using and testing validation with form objects.
Using Docker For Development mar 24
Advices on how to contain your dev environment in an isolated environment.
Heuristics for recognizing professional testers mar 25
List of skills that you need to look for when recruiting a tester.
12 Small Web Frameworks for Ruby Developers mar 25
When you don't need the full rails load, consider one of these options.
Understanding the Object Model mar 26
Deep into what is an 'object' in ruby.
Web Components, building blocks of the future web mar 27
Historic and current state of web components.
Spring-cleaning Unused CSS mar 27
In many cases 90% of your css rules are not used. Here is how to clean it up.
Thread Safety With Ruby mar 27
As rule of thumb, avoid mutations after an object is being initialized.
Rack: ArgumentError: invalid byte sequence in UTF-8 mar 29
Clean your utf8 input before it's too late.
Agile: To succeed, avoid the fundamentalists mar 29
A great retrospective on Agile Development.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
VIM configuration for Ruby on Rails applications (18m) mar 25
A curated list of great technical talks.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #91 (34m) mar 24
Not Ruining Design (Rich Thornett from Dribbble).
Ruby5 451 (6m) mar 25
Postgres and jsonb, cucumber jvm, offshore, deploying to openshift.
Ruby Rogues 149 (1h13) mar 26
Ruby in Government with Sarah Allen.
Arrested DevOps 9 (1h10) mar 27
Fast and Furious: Configuration Drift.
Ruby5 452 (7m) mar 28
Mock5, Ahoy, Lexeme, Rails 4 rc2, ping pong, small web framework.
